newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait M3 falls in December year-on-year.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait M3 falls in December year-on-year.

text.p: Kuwait's broadly-defined M3 money supply fell to 7.351 billion dinars in December from 7.437 billion in December 1995, the Central Bank's monthly bulletin showed.
M1 = Currency in circulation with the public and private dinar sight deposits.

M2 = M1 plus dinar savings deposits, dinar time deposits, foreign currency deposits, and those certificates of deposit issued by Kuwaiti banks that are held by other parties (i.e. excluding those held by the banks themselves).
M3 = M2 plus private sector deposits with deposit-accepting investment companies.
The data covers eight commercial and specialised banks, the Islamic institution Kuwait Finance House , branch of a Bahrain-based bank as well as domestic investment companies which take deposits.
